oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soldiers preparing for patrol

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ten members of 194th MP Security Platoon on Vung Chua Mountain posing before patrol. Two are largely hidden. Visible, left to right, are Hammonds, Doughty, Riggle, Race, Manning, Lark, Thomas, and Leech. Two deuce-and-a-half trucks are beside and behind the group. All soldiers are armed and wearing hemets.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Military vehicles
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; Vung Chua Mountain (Vietnam); Qui Nhon (Vietnam)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons was assigned to the 194th MP Company (attached to the First Signal Brigade), which was serving as a security force on Vung Chua Mountain near the city of Qui Nhon on the South China Sea coast. Vung Chua Mountain was one of several signal sites up and down Vietnam that provided line-of-sight and other radio traffic.
